Task.TaskDescription:
In the foothills of the Wasatch Mountains near Brigham City, Utah, there is a small <<<<<<< HEAD <<<<<<< HEAD <<<<<<< HEAD ======= >>>>>>> 31f2bd04d511378cf22c756320275a1947bb28a4 ======= >>>>>>> 512ee811f800c35bedd7b7178d45c3bff7fa7532 valley that is home to a rabbit population of 53 rabbits and 4 bobcats.

The rabbits have a birth rate of 1.5 per rabbit per year. However, the number of bobcats affects the rabbit death rate so the number of rabbit deaths is: Rabbit Population * Rabbit Death Coefficient * Bobcat Population, where the Rabbit Death Coefficient is 0.25.

The bobcats have a death rate of .25 per bobcat per year. The number of rabbits affects the bobcat birth rate so the number of bobcat births is: Bobcat Birthrate * Bobcat Population * Rabbit Population, where the Bobcat Birth Coefficient is 0.005.

Construct a model that shows the change in the rabbit and bobcat populations over <<<<<<< HEAD <<<<<<< HEAD ======= valley that is home to a rabbit population of 10 rabbits and two bobcats.

The rabbits have a birth rate of 73% per year and a death rate of 36.5% per year. However, the number of bobcats has a further effect on the rabbit death rate so the number of rabbit deaths is: rabbit population * rabbit death rate * bobcat population.

The bobcats have a birth rate of 36.5% per year and a death rate of 50% per year. However, the number of rabbits has an additional effect on the bobcat birth rate so the number of bobcat births is: bobcat birthrate * bobcat population * rabbit population.

Construct a model that shows the daily change in the rabbit and bobcat populations over >>>>>>> master ======= >>>>>>> 31f2bd04d511378cf22c756320275a1947bb28a4 ======= >>>>>>> 512ee811f800c35bedd7b7178d45c3bff7fa7532 a period of 10 years. Assume that births and deaths are the only change in the population. Immigration and emigration do not occur.
